result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachariah R Lund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling per agent to include anger management and domestic abuse counseling.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.
Consecutive to: any other sentences.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachariah R Lund in court with attorney David Susens.  Defendant Zachariah R Lund in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises other cases are being resolved today as well.  Attorney Susens agrees and request electronic monitoring, per jail rules on 15CM142.  State agrees.  82 days credit.  Court received revocation and warrant.  Attorney Susens received revocation summary as well and has reviewed.  Court imposes:
8 months Sauk County Jail, consecutive with huber privileges and EMP approved.  
82 days credit. 
  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Zachariah R Lund in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Count 1.  Dismiss/read in Count 2.  State gives joint recommendation.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
18 months Probation
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Undergo anger management and domestic abuse counseling per agent.
Expungement after probation completion and costs paid in full.
$243.00 costs, $200.00 DNA surcharge. and $100.00 domestic abuse surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
